subject: Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: Hello, Here is my practice about TDD in my daily life , But I dont know if I make any mistakes, so could you please tell me how to practice TDD in your daily
messageBody:
Hello,
Here is my practice about TDD in my daily life , But I dont know if
I make any mistakes, so could you please tell me how to practice TDD
in your daily work?Any suggestions or recommendations will be most
appreciated.
Below is one real world practice in my TDD practice:
Requirement: Reverse the setence 'TDD is a software devolopment
technology' to 'technology devolopment software a is TDD'.
Attention please, this is all requirement.

I started my coding by following below instruction:
1. Quickly add a test.
2. Run all tests and see the new one fail.
3. Make a little change.
4. Run all tests and see them all succeed.
5. Refactor to remove duplication.

First step I write a test case to describe the requirement.

package org.opensource.test;
import org.junit.Assert;
import org.junit.Test;
public class StringReverseTest {
@Test
public void testReverse(){
StringReverser sr=new StringReverser();
String str = "Tdd is a software devolopment technology";
Assert.assertEquals("technology devolopment software a is
Tdd",sr.reverse(str));
}
}

I write the product code to ensure compile successful :

package org.opensource.test;
public class StringReverser {
public Object reverse(String str) {
return null;
}
}
Second step run the test case and be sure the test case is failure.

Third step I write the simplest code that I consider to be work.

package org.opensource.test;
public class StringReverser {
public Object reverse(String str) {
return "technology devolopment software a is Tdd";
}
}

Now the requirement is implemented.

The final step is to refactor to remove duplicate code.

a) Remove the duplicate string in the test case and product code.

package org.opensource.test;
public class StringReverser {
public String reverse(String str) {
String[] words=str.split(" ");
StringBuilder result=new StringBuilder();
for (int i = words.length-1; i >=0; i--) {
result.append(words[i]).append(" ");
}
return result.toString().trim();
}
}

b) Remove the literal blank space string in the product code.

package org.opensource.test;
public class StringReverser {
private static final String SPACE = " ";
public String reverse(String str) {
String[] words=str.split(SPACE);
StringBuilder result=new StringBuilder();
for (int i = words.length-1; i >=0; i--) {
result.append(words[i]).append(SPACE);
}
return result.toString().trim();
}
}

Run all the test case and successful.

Finished.I finished my coding and work.

I do this in my daily life but many friend don't agree with me. there
opinion is that should not
write so much code. In addition my refactor is not refactoring because
I change the function of original method.

I am a novice about TDD though I do this in my daily work ,but now I
am confused with my TDD practice
Could you tell me what wrong with it and how to do in your daily work?

Any suggestions or recommendations will be most appreciated!

ATTENTION PLEASE!!! Don't take into account that that will pass
another sentence to the function

Best Regards
Yang Gu
